alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 5:48AM EDT until April 10 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Lexington and Calhoun Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting McCormick and Edgefield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stevens Creek Near Modoc. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
